entries.name: Special
entries: You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren't mounted.

entries.name: Special
entries: A Large or smaller creature hit by a net is {@condition Restrained|Ishiir} until it is freed. A net has no effect on creatures that are formless, or creatures that are Huge or larger. A creature can use its action to make a DC 10 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) also frees the creature without harming it, ending the effect and destroying the net. When you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, or {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to attack with a net, you can make only one attack regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

baseitem.name: Energy Weapons
entries: This includes energy weapons from spells and other features, but only those that are wielded, e.g. from the Soul Knife rogue subclass or the {@spell Shadow Blade|Ishiir} spell.

baseitem.name: Padded Armor
entries: Padded armor consists of quilted layers of cloth and batting.

baseitem.name: Leather Armor
entries: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

baseitem.name: Hide Armor
entries: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts. It is commonly worn by barbarian tribes, evil humanoids, and other folk who lack access to the tools and materials needed to create better armor.

baseitem.name: Studded Leather Armor
entries: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

baseitem.name: Light Chain Armor
entries: Made of interlocking metal rings, this armor is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

baseitem.name: Light Scale Armor
entries: Made of interlocking scales, this scale armor is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the scales rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

baseitem.name: Scale Mail Armor
entries: This armor consists of a coat and leggings (and perhaps a separate skirt) of leather covered with overlapping pieces of metal, much like the scales of a fish. The suit includes gauntlets.

baseitem.name: Breastplate Armor
entries: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.

baseitem.name: Halfplate Armor
entries: Half plate consists of shaped metal plates that cover most of the wearer's body. It does not include leg protection beyond simple greaves that are attached with leather straps.

baseitem.name: Ring Mail Armor
entries: This armor is leather armor with heavy rings sewn into it. The rings help reinforce the armor against blows from swords and axes. Ring mail is inferior to chain mail, and it's usually worn only by those who can't afford better armor.

baseitem.name: Chain Mail Armor
entries: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows. The suit includes gauntlets.

baseitem.name: Splint Mail Armor
entries: This armor is made of narrow vertical strips of metal riveted to a backing of leather that is worn over cloth padding. Flexible chain mail protects the joints.

baseitem.name: Full Plate Armor
entries: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

baseitem.name: Shield
entries: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

baseitem.name: Steel Ingot
entries: A molded piece of steel suitable for crafting.

baseitem.name: Alchemical Silver Ingot
entries: An alchemically processed molded piece of silver.
Not usable as base material for crafting.

baseitem.name: Cold Iron Ingot
entries: A molded piece of cold iron.
Not usable as base material for crafting.

baseitem.name: High Steel Ingot
entries: A molded piece of high steel suitable for crafting.

baseitem.name: Mithral Ingot
entries: A molded piece of mithral suitable for crafting.

baseitem.name: Adamantite Ingot
entries: A molded piece of adamantite suitable for crafting.

baseitem.name: Hide
entries: A piece of hide from a creature suitable for crafting.

baseitem.name: Scale
entries: A scale from a creature suitable for crafting.

baseitem.name: Wood
entries: A piece of simple wood suitable for crafting.

baseitem.name: Beast Hide
entries: A hide from a beast suitable for crafting.

baseitem.name: Beast Scale
entries: A scale from a beast suitable for crafting.

baseitem.name: Ironbark
entries: A piece of ironbark wood suitable for crafting.

baseitem.name: Monstrous Hide
entries: A hide from a monstrous creature suitable for crafting.

baseitem.name: Monstrous Scale
entries: A scale from a monstrous creature suitable for crafting.

baseitem.name: Livewood
entries: A piece of livewood suitable for crafting.

baseitem.name: Ancient Hide
entries: A hide from an ancient creature suitable for crafting.

baseitem.name: Ancient Scale
entries: A scale from an ancient creature suitable for crafting.

baseitem.name: Mystoak
entries: A piece of mystoak wood suitable for crafting.

baseitem.name: Forge
entries: A forge used for smelting {@item steel ingot|Ishiir|steel} and {@item high steel ingot|Ishiir|high steel}.

baseitem.name: Enchanted Forge
entries: An enchanted forge used for smelting {@item mithral ingot|Ishiir|mithral}.

baseitem.name: Blessed Forge
entries: A blessed forge used for smelting {@item adamantite ingot|Ishiir|adamantite}.

baseitem.name: Well
entries: A well used for processing {@item hide|Ishiir|hides}, {@item beast hide|Ishiir|beast hides}, {@item scale|Ishiir|scales}, {@item beast scale|Ishiir|beast scales}, {@item wood|Ishiir}, and {@item ironbark|Ishiir}.

baseitem.name: Enchanted Well
entries: An enchanted well used for processing {@item mounstrous hide|Ishiir|mounstrous hides}, {@item mounstrous scale|Ishiir|mounstrous scales}, and {@item livewood|Ishiir}.

baseitem.name: Blessed Well
entries: A blessed well used for processing {@item ancient hide|Ishiir|ancient hides}, {@item ancient scale|Ishiir|ancient scales}, and {@item mystoak|Ishiir}.

baseitem.name: Eldritch Blood
entries: Blood harvested from an aberration type creature.

baseitem.name: Eldritch Heart
entries: A heart harvested from an aberration type creature.

baseitem.name: Eldritch Brain
entries: A brain harvested from an aberration type creature.

baseitem.name: Beast Claw
entries: A claw harvested from a beast type creature.

baseitem.name: Beast Fang
entries: A claw harvested from a beast type creature.

baseitem.name: Beast Feather
entries: A feather harvested from a beast type creature.

baseitem.name: Beast Heart
entries: A claw harvested from a beast type creature.

baseitem.name: Mechanical Core
entries: A mechanical core harvested from a construct type creature.

baseitem.name: Arcane Core
entries: An arcane core harvested from a construct type creature.

baseitem.name: Living Crystal Core
entries: A living crystal core harvested from a construct type creature.

baseitem.name: Draconic Scale
entries: A scale from a draconic type creature.

baseitem.name: Draconic Eye
entries: An eye from a draconic type creature.

baseitem.name: Draconic Heart
entries: A heart from a draconic type creature.

baseitem.name: Elder Draconic Scale
entries: A scale from an elder draconic type creature.

baseitem.name: Elder Draconic Eye
entries: An eye from an elder draconic type creature.

baseitem.name: Elder Draconic Heart
entries: A heart from an elder draconic type creature.

baseitem.name: Draconic Karfunkel
entries: A gemstone from a draconic type creature.

baseitem.name: Living Earth
entries: A piece of living earth from an elemental type creature.

baseitem.name: Living Fire
entries: A piece of living fire from an elemental type creature.

baseitem.name: Living Water
entries: A piece of living water from an elemental type creature.

baseitem.name: Living Wind
entries: A piece of living wind from an elemental type creature.

baseitem.name: Living Crystal
entries: A piece of living crystal from an elemental type creature.

baseitem.name: Sylvan Dust
entries: A pinch of dust from a fey type creature.

baseitem.name: Sylvan Hair
entries: A piece of hair from a fey type creature.

baseitem.name: Sylvan Kiss
entries: A kiss from a fey type creature.

baseitem.name: Sylvan Noble Blood
entries: Blood from a fey type creature.

baseitem.name: Fiendish Fang
entries: A fang from a fiend type creature.

baseitem.name: Fiendish Blood
entries: Blood from a fiend type creature.

baseitem.name: Fiendish Heart
entries: A heart from a fiend type creature.

baseitem.name: Giant Blood
entries: Blood from a giant type creature.

baseitem.name: Giant Hair
entries: A piece of hair from a giant type creature.

baseitem.name: Giant Heart
entries: A heart from a giant type creature.

baseitem.name: Elder Giant Blood
entries: Blood from an elder giant type creature.

baseitem.name: Elder Giant Heart
entries: A heart from an elder giant type creature.

baseitem.name: Ooze Slime
entries: Slime from an ooze type creature.

baseitem.name: Ooze Nucleus
entries: A nucleus from an ooze type creature.

baseitem.name: Ooze Blood
entries: Blood from an ooze type creature.

baseitem.name: Resin Blood
entries: Blood from a plant type creature.

baseitem.name: Living Heartwood
entries: A piece of wood from a plant type creature.

baseitem.name: Vineheart
entries: A heart from a plant type creature.

baseitem.name: Accursed Blood
entries: Blood from an undead type creature.

baseitem.name: Spectral Dust
entries: A pinch of dust from an undead type creature.

baseitem.name: Accursed Heart
entries: A heart from an undead type creature.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Angrosh
entries: A blessing from the hammer lord.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Gargan
entries: A blessing from the great serpent.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Gren
entries: A blessing from the clever trickster.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Graffir
entries: A blessing from the wolf of winter.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Krumr
entries: A blessing from the storm's fury.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Lanathiil
entries: A blessing from the green lord.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Perinae
entries: A blessing from the lifegiver.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Naushindhor
entries: A blessing from the guardian of secret knowledge.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Rahya
entries: A blessing from the radiant sun.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Setifor
entries: A blessing from the oathkeeper.

baseitem.name: Blessing of the Pale Knight
entries: A blessing from the pale knight.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Vaeraustraee
entries: A blessing from the veiled lady.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Xavarash
entries: A blessing from the destroyer.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Charyptoroth
entries: A blessing from the maw of the deep.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Azzagrazzt
entries: A blessing from the dark prince of deceit.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Athar'Hagaz
entries: A blessing from the hunter of gods.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Golgathor
entries: A blessing from the blood drinker.

baseitem.name: Blessing of G'zarogg
entries: A blessing from the eternal hunger.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Belhifesh
entries: A blessing from the plaguebringer.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Tasfashir
entries: A blessing from the bearer of forbidden knowledge.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Vaasaleth
entries: A blessing from the queen of desire.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Aathoth
entries: A blessing from the oathbreaker.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Xarsateth
entries: A blessing from the queen of bones.

baseitem.name: Blessing of Araushneth
entries: A blessing from the queen of dark.

baseitem.name: Armorsmith's Tools
additionalEntries: Armorsmith's tools allow you to work metal, heating it to alter its shape, repair damage, or work raw ingots into useful pieces of {@filter armor|items|source=Ishiir|type=craftable|crafting skill=Armorsmithing}.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Armorsmith's tools include raising hammers, tongs, charcoal, rags, and a whetstone.

additionalEntries.name: Arcana and History
entries: Your expertise lends you additional insight when examining metal armors.

additionalEntries.name: Investigation
entries: You can spot clues and make deductions that others might overlook when an investigation involves armor or other metalwork.

additionalEntries.name: Repair
entries: With access to your tools and an open flame hot enough to make metal pliable, you can restore 10 hit points to a damaged metal object for each hour of work.

baseitem.name: Weaponsmith's Tools
additionalEntries: Weaponsmith's tools allow you to work metal, heating it to alter its shape, repair damage, or work raw ingots into useful melee {@filter weaponry|items|source=Ishiir|type=craftable|crafting skill=Weaponsmithing}.

baseitem.name: Tinker's Tools
additionalEntries: A set of tinker's tools is designed to enable you perform a free-form type of crafting.

baseitem.name: Weaver's Tools
additionalEntries: Weaver's tools allow you to create cloth and tailor it into articles of clothing.

baseitem.name: Woodcarver's Tools
additionalEntries: Woodcarver's tools allow you to craft intricate objects from wood, such as wooden tokens or arrows.

baseitem.name: Alchemist's Supplies
additionalEntries: Alchemist's supplies enable a character to produce useful {@filter concoctions|items|source=Ishiir|type=craftable|crafting skill=Alchemy}, such as acid or alchemist's fire.

baseitem.name: Brewer's Supplies
additionalEntries: Brewing is the art of producing beer. Not only does beer serve as an alcoholic beverage, but the process of brewing purifies water. Crafting beer takes weeks of fermentation, but only a few hours of work.

baseitem.name: Calligrapher's Supplies
additionalEntries: Calligraphy treats writing as a delicate, beautiful art. Calligraphers produce text that is pleasing to the eye, using a style that is difficult to forge. Their supplies also give them some ability to examine scripts and determine if they are legitimate, since a calligrapher's training involves long hours of studying writing and attempting to replicate its style and design.

baseitem.name: Carpenter's Tools
additionalEntries: Skill at carpentry enables a character to construct wooden structures. A carpenter can build a house, a shack, a wooden cabinet, or similar items.

baseitem.name: Cartographer's Tools
additionalEntries: Using cartographer's tools, you can create accurate maps to make travel easier for yourself and those who come after you. These maps can range from large-scale depictions of mountain ranges to diagrams that show the layout of a dungeon level.

baseitem.name: Cobbler's Tools
additionalEntries: Although the cobbler's trade might seem too humble for an adventurer, a good pair of boots will see a character across rugged wilderness and through deadly dungeons.

baseitem.name: Cook's Utensils
additionalEntries: Adventuring is a hard life. With a cook along on the journey, your {@filter meals|items|source=Ishiir|type=craftable|crafting skill=Cooking} will be much better than the typical mix of hardtack and dried fruit.

baseitem.name: Glassblower's Tools
additionalEntries: Someone who is {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with glassblower's tools has not only the ability to shape glass, but also specialized knowledge of the methods used to produce glass objects.

baseitem.name: Jeweler's Tools
additionalEntries: Training with jeweler's tools includes the basic techniques needed to beautify gems. It also gives you expertise in identifying precious stones.

baseitem.name: Leatherworker's Tools
additionalEntries: Knowledge of leatherworking extends to lore concerning animal hides and their properties. It allows you to craft {@filter leather and scale armor|items|source=Ishiir|type=craftable|crafting skill=Leatherworking}.

baseitem.name: Mason's Tools
additionalEntries: Mason's tools allow you to craft stone structures, including walls and buildings crafted from brick.

baseitem.name: Painter's Supplies
additionalEntries: {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with painter's supplies represents your ability to paint and draw. You also acquire an understanding of art history, which can aid you in examining works of art.

baseitem.name: Potter's Tools
additionalEntries: Potter's tools are used to create a variety of ceramic objects, most typically pots and similar vessels.

baseitem.name: Enchanter's Supplies
additionalEntries: A set of enchanter's supplies is designed to enable you to create {@filter magical objects|items|source=Ishiir|type=craftable|crafting skill=Enchanting}.

baseitem.name: Fletcher's Tools
additionalEntries: A set of fletcher's tools is designed to enable you to create {@filter ranged weaponry and ammunition|items|source=Ishiir|type=craftable|crafting skill=Fletching}.

baseitem.name: Herbalist's Kit
additionalEntries: An herbalist's kit is designed to enable you to create {@filter restorative potions, ointments and balms|items|source=Ishiir|type=craftable|crafting skill=Herbalism}.

baseitem.name: Poisoner's Kit
additionalEntries: An poisoner's kit is designed to enable you to create deadly {@filter poisons|items|source=Ishiir|type=craftable|crafting skill=Poisonmaking}.

entries.name: Ammunition
entries: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. Loading a one-handed weapon requires a free hand. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.
If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon. A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

entries.name: Ammunition
entries: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver, case, or other container is part of the attack. Loading a one-handed weapon requires a free hand. The ammunition of a firearm is destroyed upon use.
If you use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a melee attack, you treat the weapon as an improvised weapon. A sling must be loaded to deal any damage when used in this way.

entries.name: Burst Fire
entries: A weapon that has the burst fire property can make a single-target attack, or it can spray a 10-foot-cube area within normal range with shots. Each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir} or take the weapon's normal damage. This action uses ten pieces of ammunition.

entries.name: Finesse
entries: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

entries.name: Heavy
entries: Small creatures have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir|Attack Rolls} with heavy weapons. A heavy weapon's size and bulk make it too large for a Small creature to use effectively. Before you make a melee attack with a heavy melee weapon that you are proficient with, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the attack's damage.

entries.name: Light
entries: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.

entries.name: Loading
entries: Because of the time required to load this weapon, you can fire only one piece of ammunition from it when you use an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir}, or {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to fire it, regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.

entries.name: Reach
entries: This weapon adds 5 feet to your reach when you attack with it. This property also determines your reach for opportunity attacks with a reach weapon.

entries.name: Reload
entries: A limited number of shots can be made with a weapon that has the reload property. A character must then reload it using an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir} or a {@variantrule Bonus Action|Ishiir} (the character's choice).

entries.name: Thrown
entries: If a weapon has the thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack. If the weapon is a melee weapon, you use the same ability modifier for that {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir} and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon. For example, if you throw a handaxe, you use your Strength, but if you throw a dagger, you can use either your Strength or your Dexterity, since the dagger has the finesse property.

entries.name: Two-Handed
entries: This weapon requires two hands to use. This property is relevant only when you attack with the weapon, not when you simply hold it.

entries.name: Versatile
entries: This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the propertythe damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.

itemType.name: Artisan's Tools
entries: These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade. {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to any {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks} you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}.

itemType.name: Gaming Set
entries: If you are {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir|proficient} with a gaming set, you can add your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks} you make to play a game with that set. Each type of gaming set requires a separate {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}.

itemType.name: Instrument
entries: If you have {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with a given musical instrument, you can add your {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} bonus to any {@variantrule Ability Check|Ishiir|Ability Checks} you make to play music with the instrument. A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus. Each type of musical instrument requires a separate {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir}.

entries.name: Range
entries: A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range shown in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon's normal range in feet, and the second indicates the weapon's maximum range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|Ishiir} on the {@variantrule Attack Roll|Ishiir}. You can't attack a target beyond the weapon's long range.

itemType.name: Trade Good
entries: Most wealth is not in coins. It is measured in livestock, grain, land, rights to collect taxes, or rights to resources (such as a mine or a forest).

Guilds, nobles, and royalty regulate trade. Chartered companies are granted rights to conduct trade along certain routes, to send merchant ships to various ports, or to buy or sell specific goods. Guilds set prices for the goods or services that they control, and determine who may or may not offer those goods and services. Merchants commonly exchange trade goods without using currency.

entries.name: Crew
entries: A ship needs a crew of skilled hirelings to function. As per the Player's Handbook, one skilled hireling costs at least 2 gp per day. The minimum number of skilled hirelings needed to crew a ship depends on the type of vessel.

You can track the loyalty of individual crew members or the crew as a whole using the optional loyalty rules in chapter 4 of the Dungeon Master's Guide. If at least half the crew becomes disloyal during a voyage, the crew turns hostile and stages a mutiny. If the ship is berthed, disloyal crew members leave the ship and never return.

entries.name: Passengers
entries: This indicates the number of Small and Medium passengers the ship can accommodate.
Accommodations consist of shared hammocks in tight quarters. A ship outfitted with private accommodations can carry one-fifth as many passengers.
A passenger is usually expected to pay 5 sp per day for a hammock, but prices can vary from ship to ship. A small private cabin usually costs 2 gp per day.

entries.name: Cargo
entries: The maximum tonnage the ship can carry.

entries.name: Damage Threshold
entries: If a ship has a Damage Threshold, it has {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} to all damage unless it takes an amount of damage equal to or greater than its damage threshold, in which case it takes damage as normal. Any damage that fails to meet or exceed the damage threshold is considered superficial and doesn't reduce the ship's hit points.

entries.name: Ship Repair
entries: Repairs to a damaged ship can be made while the vessel is berthed. Repairing 1 hit point of damage requires 1 day and costs 20 gp for materials and labor.

itemEntry.name: Ring of Resistance
entriesTemplate: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to {{item.resist}} damage while wearing this ring. The ring is set with {{item.detail1}}.

itemEntry.name: Armor of Resistance
entriesTemplate: You have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to {{item.resist}} damage while you wear this armor.

itemEntry.name: Potion of Resistance
entriesTemplate: When you drink this potion, you gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to {{item.resist}} damage for 1 hour.

itemEntry.name: Absorbing Tattoo
entriesTemplate: Produced by a special needle, this magic tattoo features designs that emphasize one color ({{item.detail1}}).

entriesTemplate.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in your space.

entriesTemplate.name: Damage Resistance
entries: While the tattoo is on your skin, you have {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to {{item.resist}} damage.

entriesTemplate.name: Damage Absorption
entries: When you take {{item.resist}} damage, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} to gain {@variantrule Immunity|Ishiir} against that instance of the damage, and you regain a number of hit points equal to half the damage you would have taken. Once this {@variantrule Reaction|Ishiir} is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

itemEntry.name: Chromatic Rose
entriesTemplate: While this rose is held, it {{item.detail1}} as a harmless visual effect.

While holding the rose by its stem, you gain {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir} to {{item.resist}} damage. If you would take more than 10 {{item.resist}} damage from a single source (after applying the {@variantrule Resistance|Ishiir}), the rose disintegrates, and you take no damage instead.

As an {@variantrule Action|Ishiir}, you can blow the petals from the rose to produce a 20-foot cone of {{item.resist}}. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 15 Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|Ishiir}, taking {@damage 3d10} {{item.resist}} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Using this property destroys the rose.

entries: {@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with a musical instrument indicates you are familiar with the techniques used to play it. You also have knowledge of some songs commonly performed with that instrument.

entries.name: History
entries: Your expertise aids you in recalling lore related to your instrument.

entries.name: Performance
entries: Your ability to put on a good show is improved when you incorporate an instrument into your act.

entries.name: Compose a Tune
entries: As part of a {@variantrule Long Rest|Ishiir}, you can compose a new tune and lyrics for your instrument. You might use this ability to impress a noble or spread scandalous rumors with a catchy tune.
{@variantrule Proficiency|Ishiir} with a gaming set applies to one type of game, such as Three-Dragon Ante or games of chance that use dice.

entries.name: Components
entries: A gaming set has all the pieces needed to play a specific game or type of game, such as a complete deck of cards or a board and tokens.

entries.name: History
entries: Your mastery of a game includes knowledge of its history, as well as of important events it was connected to or prominent historical figures involved with it.

entries.name: Insight
entries: Playing games with someone is a good way to gain understanding of their personality, granting you a better ability to discern their lies from their truths and read their mood.

entries.name: Sleight of Hand
entries: Sleight of Hand is a useful skill for cheating at a game, as it allows you to swap pieces, palm cards, or alter a die roll. Alternatively, engrossing a target in a game by manipulating the components with dexterous movements is a great distraction for a pickpocketing attempt.

entries.caption: Gaming Set
rows: Gain insight into an opponent's personality
